summary: This is a legal hold notice from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Office of the General Counsel, issued on August 14, 2019, instructing custodians to preserve all records and electronically stored information related to the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. The notice anticipates litigation and outlines strict preservation requirements.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the legal hold notice. He was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, in an apparent suicide and later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Michael Cannata
persons.context: The recipient or subject of the legal hold notice, as indicated in the filename. Identified as an individual likely to have relevant information requiring preservation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found dead in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at around 6:30 am in an apparent suicide. He was subsequently pronounced dead at a local hospital.

events.title: BOP issues legal hold notice
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons Office of the General Counsel issues a legal hold notice (LHN-CIV-2019-00204) to preserve all records and electronically stored information related to Epstein's death, anticipating litigation.

locations: 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007 (Office of the General Counsel, Federal Bureau of Prisons address)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, at around 6:30 am, in an apparent suicide and later pronounced dead.
The Federal Bureau of Prisons issued a legal hold notice on August 14, 2019, to preserve all records related to Epstein's death, indicating anticipation of litigation.
The notice instructs custodians, including Michael Cannata, to preserve all electronic and physical documents and warns against altering or destroying information.
The document is marked as 'Privileged and Confidential' and instructs recipients not to forward or share the notice with anyone.
